This Visualization Might Surprise You](http://thedailyviz.com/2016/09/17/how-common-is-your-birthday-dailyviz/) ### Recommended - {{< fa video >}} [The Fallen of World War II](http://www.fallen.io/ww2/) - {{< fa file-pdf >}} [Visualizing Statistical Mix Effects and Simpson's Paradox](https://static.googleusercontent.com/media/research.google.com/en//pubs/archive/42901.pdf) [@ArmstrongWattenberg:2014] - {{< fa arrow-up-right-from-square >}} [How To Fix a Toilet (And Other Things We Couldn't Do Without Search)](http://how-to-fix-a-toilet.com/) ### Possible questions to reflect on ::: {.callout-warning} #### This is not a required list! Remember, you don't need to answer all of these—or even any of them! These are just here to help guide your thinking. **Write about whatever you want.** ::: - When is it okay (or not) to truncate the y-axis? - It is remarkably easy to mislead people with many of these chart types. Why? How can you avoid the same mistakes? - All these types of charts are good at communicating change over time, but some are more appropriate in different situations.
